items.title: Statute of limitations could limit DOJ from further prosecuting James Comey
items.standfirst: A federal judge has dismissed the criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson joins with analysis.
items.content: A federal judge has dismissed the criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson joins with analysis.

items.title: Judge tosses out cases against James Comey and Letitia James
items.standfirst: A federal judge dismissed the criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James on the grounds that Lindsey Halligan, the interim U.S. attorney who secured their indictments, was unlawfully appointed to the role. Scott MacFarlane has more.
items.content: A federal judge dismissed the criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James on the grounds that Lindsey Halligan, the interim U.S. attorney who secured their indictments, was unlawfully appointed to the role. Scott MacFarlane has more.

items.title: Judge dismisses cases against ex-FBI director Comey and NY attorney general James
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has repeatedly called for the prosecution of Comey and James, declaring them "guilty as hell".
items.content: President Donald Trump has repeatedly called for the prosecution of Comey and James, declaring them "guilty as hell".

items.title: US judge dismisses charges against James Comey and Letitia James
items.standfirst: Ruling found the appointment of Donald Trump ally Lindsey Halligan as interim US attorney was unconstitutional
items.content: Ruling found the appointment of Donald Trump ally Lindsey Halligan as interim US attorney was unconstitutional

items.title: US judge dismisses criminal charges against James Comey, Letitia James
items.standfirst: The court found that lawyer Lindsey Halligan had been illegally appointed to her role as acting US attorney under Trump.
items.content: The court found that lawyer Lindsey Halligan had been illegally appointed to her role as acting US attorney under Trump.

items.title: US judge dismisses case against former FBI director James Comey
items.standfirst: A US judge on Monday dismissed criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James on the grounds that the attorney bringing the cases, who was selected by US President Donald Trump, was unlawfully appointed. The previous attorney declined to pursue charges against Comey or James, citing a lack of credible evidence in both cases.
items.content: A US judge on Monday dismissed criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James on the grounds that the attorney bringing the cases, who was selected by US President Donald Trump, was unlawfully appointed. The previous attorney declined to pursue charges against Comey or James, citing a lack of credible evidence in both cases.

items.title: Judge tosses Comey, James cases after finding prosecutor unlawfully appointed
items.standfirst: The judge's decision on the appointment of Lindsey Halligan marks a significant setback to efforts to go after the president's perceived political enemies.
items.content: The judge's decision on the appointment of Lindsey Halligan marks a significant setback to efforts to go after the president's perceived political enemies.(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)

ai_summary: A federal judge dismissed criminal charges against James Comey and Letitia James.
The judge ruled Lindsey Halligan's appointment as interim U.S. attorney was unconstitutional.
Halligan secured the indictments against Comey and James.
President Trump repeatedly called for the prosecution of Comey and James.
The statute of limitations could limit further prosecution of James Comey.

items.title: Trump moves to classify Muslim Brotherhood chapters as ‘terrorist organizations'
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Monday signed an executive order launching a process to designate specific branches of the Muslim Brotherhood as foreign terrorist organisations. The order singles out chapters in Lebanon, Egypt and Jordan, and hands the task of completing the designation to top US diplomats and Treasury officials.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Monday signed an executive order launching a process to designate specific branches of the Muslim Brotherhood as foreign terrorist organisations. The order singles out chapters in Lebanon, Egypt and Jordan, and hands the task of completing the designation to top US diplomats and Treasury officials.

items.title: Trump orders blacklisting Muslim Brotherhood branches as ‘terrorist’ groups
items.standfirst: White House cites groups' alleged support for Hamas, accusing them of waging campaign against US interests and allies.
items.content: White House cites groups' alleged support for Hamas, accusing them of waging campaign against US interests and allies.

items.title: Trump begins process of designating Muslim Brotherhood chapters as terrorist groups
items.standfirst: President signs executive order for Rubio and Bessent to submit report on chapters in Lebanon, Egypt and JordanDonald Trump on Monday began the process of designating certain Muslim Brotherhood chapters as foreign terrorist organizations and specially designated global terrorists, a move that would bring sanctions against one of the Arab world’s oldest and most influential Islamist movements.Trump signed an executive order directing Secretary of State Marco Rubio and treasury secretary Scott Bessent to submit a report on whether to designate any Muslim Brotherhood chapters, such as those in Lebanon, Egypt and Jordan, according to a White House fact sheet. It orders the secretaries to move forward with any designations within 45 days of the report. Continue reading...
items.content: President signs executive order for Rubio and Bessent to submit report on chapters in Lebanon, Egypt and JordanDonald Trump on Monday began the process of designating certain Muslim Brotherhood chapters as foreign terrorist organizations and specially designated global terrorists, a move that would bring sanctions against one of the Arab world’s oldest and most influential Islamist movements.Trump signed an executive order directing Secretary of State Marco Rubio and treasury secretary Scott Bessent to submit a report on whether to designate any Muslim Brotherhood chapters, such as those in Lebanon, Egypt and Jordan, according to a White House fact sheet. It orders the secretaries to move forward with any designations within 45 days of the report. Continue reading...

ai_summary: President Trump signed an executive order regarding the Muslim Brotherhood.
The order initiates a process to designate specific branches as foreign terrorist organizations.
The order singles out chapters in Lebanon, Egypt, and Jordan.
The White House cited alleged support for Hamas by the groups.
The order directs officials to submit a report within 45 days.

items.title: Taliban accuses Pakistan of killing 10 – including nine children – in strikes on Afghanistan
items.standfirst: The strikes come a day after a suicide attack on a security compound in Pakistan’s Peshawar cityPakistan strikes on neighbouring Afghanistan have killed 10 people – among them nine children – a Taliban government spokesperson has said, a day after a suicide attack on a security compound in Pakistan’s Peshawar city.“The Pakistani invading forces bombed the house of a local civilian resident ... As a result, nine children (five boys and four girls) and one woman were martyred” in Khost province, Zabihullah Mujahid said on X. Continue reading...
items.content: The strikes come a day after a suicide attack on a security compound in Pakistan’s Peshawar cityPakistan strikes on neighbouring Afghanistan have killed 10 people – among them nine children – a Taliban government spokesperson has said, a day after a suicide attack on a security compound in Pakistan’s Peshawar city.“The Pakistani invading forces bombed the house of a local civilian resident ... As a result, nine children (five boys and four girls) and one woman were martyred” in Khost province, Zabihullah Mujahid said on X. Continue reading...

items.content: Pakistan carried out air strikes inside Afghanistan on Tuesday, killing at least 10 civilians, according to the Taliban government, a day after a deadly suicide blast on a security compound in Peshawar intensified tensions between the neighbours.

items.title: US and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation to end operations in territory
items.standfirst: Four main food distribution sites operated by the opaque company had been flashpoints of deadly violence A controversial and secretive private company backed by the US and Israel that distributed food in Gaza has announced the end of its operations in the devastated territory.The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), which had four food distribution sites that became flashpoints of chaos and deadly violence between May and October, said in a statement that it would shut down permanently, having “successfully completed its emergency mission”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Majority of Latino voters disapprove of Trump, Pew study finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Latino Voters Show Disapproval of Trump's Policies
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, NPR News

items.title: Majority of Latino voters disapprove of Trump, Pew study finds
items.standfirst: Research shows 70% disapprove of job US president – who won backing of nearly half of Latino voters in 2024 – is doingA majority of Latinos disapprove of Donald Trump and his economic and immigration policies, according to a new report from the Pew Research Center.After receiving support from nearly half of Latino voters in the 2024 election, Trump had lost the backing of a majority surveyed in October. Pew found that 70% of Latinos “disapprove of the way Trump is handling his job as president”, while 65% disapprove of his administration’s approach to immigration and 61% believe his economic policies have worsened economic conditions. Continue reading...
items.content: Research shows 70% disapprove of job US president – who won backing of nearly half of Latino voters in 2024 – is doingA majority of Latinos disapprove of Donald Trump and his economic and immigration policies, according to a new report from the Pew Research Center.After receiving support from nearly half of Latino voters in the 2024 election, Trump had lost the backing of a majority surveyed in October. Pew found that 70% of Latinos “disapprove of the way Trump is handling his job as president”, while 65% disapprove of his administration’s approach to immigration and 61% believe his economic policies have worsened economic conditions. Continue reading...
